title: Understanding Standard Form
text: The standard form for a quadratic equation is typically expressed as $${a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$. Do you know what this form is used for?

title: Identifying Components
text: In the equation $$x^2+5x-2$$, how can we identify terms that we can manipulate to form a perfect square trinomial?

title: Completing the Square
text: Completing the square involves creating a perfect square trinomial. How can we adjust $$x^2+5x$$ to form such a trinomial?

title: Perfect Square Trinomial
text: For $$x^2+5x$$, what value should you add and subtract to create a perfect square trinomial? Remember, it's based on $${\left(\frac{b}{2}\right)}^2$$, where $$b$$ is the coefficient of $$x$$.

title: Using the Value to Complete the Square
text: Can you rewrite $$x^2+5x-2$$ by adding and subtracting $${\left(\frac{5}{2}\right)}^2$$? What expression do you get when you factor the completed square?

title: Vertex Form Significance
text: Now that you completed the square, do you see how the vertex form reveals the function's vertex, $$h$$ and k? What are those values in your rewritten equation?
